measured_by: Lee & Moray (1994) two-item Trust in Automation questionnaire (0-10 rating)
justification: “Our primary measure of relative trust in automation was derived from Lee and Moray's (1994) two item questionnaire of trust in automation and self-confidence.”

measured_by: Lee & Moray (1994) self-confidence rating item (0-10 scale)
justification: Participants were “asked to indicate their level of confidence in their ability to match faces accurately…Both ratings were made on a scale from 0-10.”

measured_by: Difference score (Trust rating – Self-confidence rating) based on Lee & Moray items
justification: “Relative trust in automation was calculated by subtracting ratings of self-confidence from ratings of trust in the sAFRS.”
“These participants completed the Expertise in Facial Comparison Test (EFCT; White, Phillips, et al., 2015) in two phases: an unassisted baseline phase, and an aided task phase…”

measured_by: Glasgow Face Matching Test 2 – Short version (GFMT2-S)
justification: “Participants in Experiment 2 completed the short version of the Glasgow Face Matching Test 2 (GFMT2-S; White et al., 2022).”
